page.description: Returns the name of the next attached Library.

prototypes.prototype: Library_List as C = :A5.LIBRARY_ENUM( [ options as N ] )
Next_Library_Name as C = :A5.LIBRARY_ENUM( lastname as C )

argument.name: Library_List
argument.description: A list of letters in various formats, depending on the Flag variable.

argument.name: Next_Library_Name
argument.description: The next letter in the list of letters.

argument.name: lastname
argument.description: The quoted name of a letter.

item.name: Null = Library name, full path, and filename.
8 = Quoted Library name, full path, and filename.

page.discussion: The A5.LIBRARY_ENUM() method returns a CR-LF delimited list of all .ALB files. The .ALB file is an external library that is attached to the currently open database. By attaching an external library, you can share global scripts and other objects that were defined in other databases. To attach an external library, select File > Database Properties, and then select the Libraries tab.
